{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3495105,"name":"Tate","username":"Tatertotman","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tatertotman/{size}/246170_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-28T21:47:57.123Z","cooked":"

We are having trouble implementing the Yagsl Lockpose into our code. We took the code from the lockpose page on Yagsl’s website. We inserted them into what we think is the correct spots inside our robot container. Our Swerve Subsystem class seems to be not updated to what Yagsl standards are for this function. Is there a compatible version of Swerve Subsystem Class available to us. We are hoping you can help with this issue. here is our github . @nstrike.

  1. if (Robot.isSimulation())
    2. 
          
  2. {
    3. 
          
  3.   driverXbox.start().onTrue(Commands.runOnce(() -> drivebase.resetOdometry(new Pose2d(3, 3, new Rotation2d()))));
    4. 
          
  4.   driverXbox.button(1).whileTrue(drivebase.sysIdDriveMotorCommand());
    5.

  6. }
    7. 
          
  7. if (DriverStation.isTest())
    8. 
          
  8. {
    9. 
          
  9.   drivebase.setDefaultCommand(driveFieldOrientedAnglularVelocity); // Overrides drive command above!
    10. 
          
  10. 
          
  11.   driverXbox.x().whileTrue(Commands.runOnce(drivebase::lock, drivebase).repeatedly());
    12. 
          
  12.   driverXbox.y().whileTrue(drivebase.driveToDistanceCommand(1.0, 0.2));
    13. 
          
  13.   driverXbox.start().onTrue((Commands.runOnce(drivebase::zeroGyro)));
    14. 
          
  14.   driverXbox.back().whileTrue(drivebase.centerModulesCommand());
    15. 
          
  15.   driverXbox.leftBumper().onTrue(Commands.none());
    16.

    17.

    18.

    20. 
          
  20.   driverXbox.x().onTrue(Commands.runOnce(drivebase::addFakeVisionReading));
    21.

    22.

This is a (fairly bad imo) way to do lockPose. You just new to do something like

return run(swerveDrive::lock);
